snippet: Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who had tempered his often divisive public comments after protests a few months ago, stirs anger by attacking a new target: coed dormitories.
abstract: Turkish Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan raises storm of protest after saying he wants to outlaw coed dormitories at state universities and even extend crackdown to off-campus housing shared by male and female students; Erdogan once again pushes country's culture wars to the fore, after tempering his often divisive public comments after they led o months of protests.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu and Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who had tempered his often divisive public comments after protests a few months ago, stirs anger by attacking a new target: coed dormitories.

headline.main: After a Break, Turkey’s Prime Minister Again Courts Controversy
headline.print_headline: After a Break, Turkey’s Prime Minister Again Courts Controversy
